Key Match Events: Young had 33 points and nine assists
Okongwu had a double-double with 14 points and 11 rebounds
Davis collected an 18 point and 18 rebound double-double
Reaves had 20 points and seven assists
James put the game away with 30 points and eight assists
Young and Jaxson Hayes got called for a double technical after a brief exchange of words
Knecht hit three three-pointers in the second quarter
James hit a deep three to restore the Lakers lead to 11
Reaves and Rui Hachimura hit threes to eventually salt the game away
Pre-Game Insights: Trae Young, Dyson Daniels, Zaccharie Risacher, Jalen Johnson and Clint Capela started for the Hawks
Davis made his return to the lineup after not playing against Portland the previous night
The Hawks played three quarters of reasonably solid basketball and outplayed the Lakers in the turnover battle
The Hawks' defense was especially poor in the 2nd quarter as they allowed the Lakers to rack up fouls and keep Atlanta at arm's length
Post-Match Reflections: Bogdanovic, Capela and Johnson all converted their looks
Young did not let that happen. He starred as a finisher while also hitting a deep step-back three to give the Hawks new life
James found Reaves for an easy bucket to make it a 12-point game
James himself scored 10 points in six minutes by repeatedly cooking the Hawks defense
Miscellaneous Highlights: Young and Jaxson Hayes also got called for a double technical after a brief exchange of words
James hit a deep three to restore the Lakers lead to 11
Reaves hit another three-pointer to give LA another 11-point lead
Dorian Finney-Smith shots when they needed it most. It allowed the Lakers to take a 96-86 lead into the fourth quarter
